one_reviews_text:
This game is cross buy but not completely cross play.  If you have a Quest and a Rift, you will NOT be able to play with family at home.  This is not like Racket NX, Dead and Burried 2, Rush, and most other cross play games that allow you to play against your own device with family at home.  The game intentionally does not allow you to hook up to your other device (per the developer Armature).  To me, this is a fatal flaw, especially considering there are reviews here complaining about not having enough players to play against. Since this is not available outside of Oculus and your devices are linked to your account, there are few options to work around this, even in the unlikely event that you liked it so much, you were inclined to buy it twice.

The game is a fun and a unique idea, but not as fun when you can't share it with family.  I would recomend one of the other cross play games that allow this instead.

review_title: Solid game with a few flaws
one_reviews_text: The game itself is actually great, especially the concept guarantees for an unique experience everytime you play. But the physics seem very off sometimes, especially during baseball, it seems that no matter how hard you try to hit the ball, it always flies very far. And the fact that although you already played them, you can't skip the explanations in training/challenge mode, which makes the game process unneccessary lenghty.

Pros
-Nicely polished presentation, colorful graphics.
-Decent selection of options and modes, along with trophies and cosmetics
-Multiplayer

Cons
-Frequent poor physics on all modes, even "pro".  Not just fun, cartoon physics, but in some cases just plain buggy.  (batting in baseball is especially bad)
-No interaction with your opponent at all in bowling, and limited gameplay in baseball and tennis with drastically reduced features/rules.  


Overall, definately wouldn't recommend, especially at $30.  Maybe in the $5-10 range.  For single player content, something like VR Sports Challenge is a much better game.  And for multiplayer there are better sports-esque options available as well.

review_title: Thanks Oculus for making this crossplay!
one_reviews_text: This game was awesome on the Quest. Now I can play it on the Rift at no extra charge. I love the ability to have Oculus Friends added in multiplayer quickly so I can challenge my friends to a game of tennis while trashtalking them :) 5/5 John McEnroe Bobbleheads.

This game sets the standard for fun vr play, and cross buy between Oculus Rift and Oculus Quest.  My favorite game on Quest, and will now be a regular on Rift as well.  The physics are great, game play is unique and makes me want to get better and play more.  Cuddos to the devs and team who worked on this, YOU GUYS ROCK!

This game has everything I want in a VR sports game. The gameplay, the physics; everything feels great! I love the twist of mixing everything! It makes every game you play feel different and more exciting! And if you DONT want the crazy, you can just play the normal sport WITHOUT scrambling. This game is a must-buy for any sport buff  who is looking for a cool VR expierience. I could play this forever!

Or leave it on.   Fun either way.  Great game. Pass it on.
  Quest needs more games as good as this.
Thanks for not charging if bought on Quest.
